summary:
Hi, I'm Nontas!

Currently, I am working as a Software Engineer for ASML Netherlands. I belong to the Software and Platform Architecture group and my main interests are in Model-Driven Software Engineering, Testing, and Simulation.

Before joining ASML, I attended a two-year post-master program, called Software Technology PDEng, at the Eindhoven University of Technology. During this program, I worked on projects for major industries of the Netherlands, like Océ-Canon, ASML, and Philips.

I received my diploma in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Patras (Greece) in 2015. During my studies I specialized in Digital Signal and Image Processing.

As a student, I was a Microsoft Student Partner for several years. During this time, I led and co-founded the first and biggest offline student community of Microsoft in Greece (called StudentGuru Patras).

From 2012 until 2015, I was an external partner of Greek Yellow Pages S.A. (a company that offers the most complete business directory in Greece), where I worked on the development of their mobile app for Windows devices.

education.field_of_study: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering

awards.title: Windows Phone 7.5 Hackathon - Athens Life App
awards.description: Awarded a Nokia Lumia 800 for app "Athens Life". This app got distinction in total of 35 apps that were presenting in the Hackathon

awards.title: Microsoft Student Partners European Summit 2011 - Greek Representative
awards.description:
Selected (with 3 other students) to represent Greece at Microsoft Student Partners European Summit 2011 at Malaga, Spain. As a Greek representative, I had to present significant activities and achievements of Greek MSP Team to Microsoft employees and other MSP students from different European countries.
This award was given as an award of excellence for my results and achievements as a Microsoft Student Partner, in FY 2010-2011.

awards.description: MSP Web Champions, is a worldwide contest organized by Microsoft Corp. Participants, are called to evaluate, debug and test various popular web applications and give feedback, based on their testings.

projects.title: Greek Yellow Pages for Windows Phone
projects.description: Windows Phone app for Greek Yellow Pages S.A.

contributors.headline: Co-Founder and CEO at DeepSea Technologies

projects.title: IDE7
projects.description:
ide7 is a programming interface for Windows Phone 7 devices. Users can create their own programs on any supported language (more than 40 languages supported). Next, they can execute their code and see the results!
ide7 uses the API of IdeOne.com in order for compilation and execution of programs.

projects.title: Cosmote Services for Windows Phone 7
projects.description: Cosmote Services, is a beautiful, fast and user-friendly application for Windows Phone 7 devices, that gives quick access to a variety of services provided by greek telecommunications company "Cosmote".

projects.title: Model Driven Engineering Project for ASML
projects.description:
This project involves solving a problem following a model driven approach.

Role: As a lead integrator and configurator, I was responsible for the configuration of our infrastructure and the automation of the development process. This automation includes setting up and configuring a Jenkins server to test our software and produce builds. In addition to this, we had to ensure the correct integration of our solution, both on code and model level.

projects.title: Embedded Prescan for TASS International
projects.description:
A proof-of-concept project to explore the benefits of using PreScan on cars as assistive software in the process of autonomous driving.

Technologies: PreScan, MATLAB, Python, reacTIVision

Role: As a configuration manager, I was responsible for the configuration of my team’s machines, our repositories, and our testing environments. Our task was to explore the benefits of PreScan using RaspberyPi-enabled robot vehicles.

projects.title: ODAS System for Océ-Canon
projects.description:
The ODAS System is a sophisticated platform where engineers can create
and execute algorithms for data analysis and predictive maintenance. 

Technologies: Python, ØMQ, Jupyter

Role: As a lead designer, I supervised the software design of ODAS’ alerting system, where critical Jupyter notebooks had to be executed in parallel (Python/Multiprocessing) with a specific frequency. If critical situation was detected, a mail-alert is sent (ØMQ) to a predefined group of engineers.

projects.title: IoT Lighting Platform using DMX and Hue lights for the Intelligent Lighting Institute of TU/e
projects.description:
This project aimed at the creation of an IoT platform for an installation of DMX and Philips Hue lights of the TU/e.

Technologies: Java, CoAP, Python, Kinect SDK

Role: As a team leader, I was responsible for communicating with the client, organizing our tasks (SCRUM), and supervising the team’s progress. My team’s task was to make the DMX and the Hue lights IPv6 addressable (in a virtual way) and change each light’s state according to the packets received at its virtual IPv6 address.

projects.title: Diploma Thesis
projects.description:
Reconstruction of high-res thermal images from low-res thermal images using compressed sensing techniques.

Supervisors:
Prof. Thanos Stouraitis, Digital Signal & Image Processing Lab, Dept of ECE, Univ. of Patras
Prof. Kostas Berberidis, Signal Processing & Communications Lab, Dept of Comp. Eng & Informatics, Univ. of Patras

projects.title: Optical Character Recognition System
projects.description:
The aim of this project was to develop a simple OCR system (using Matlab), which can recognize which letters appear on a picture and in which specific order.  This was a semester project for the class of Digital Image Processing and Image analysis, supervised by Prof. K. Berberidis (Univ. of Patras/Dept. of Computer Engineering and Informatics)
Graded: 9.5/10 (top 2%)

projects.title: Simulation of full duplex communication of 2 terminals using modems
projects.description:
In this project, we simulated the communication of 2 terminals via modems (rs232), based on the protocol of XON/XOFF. This project supports full duplex communication via an ideal channel (no noise/symbol altering) and was built using MATLAB and Simulink/Stateflow, while the logic of the modems was built using Finite State Machines (FSMs).
This was a semester project for the class of Embedded Communication Systems, supervised by Prof. Theodore A. Antonakopoulos (Univ. of Patras/Dept of ECE)
Graded: 9.5/10 (top 1%)

projects.title: Althaea
projects.description:
One of the most common reasons for malpractice in medicine is misdiagnosis. The misdiagnosis of an illness may lead to significant delays of the treatment or even treatment for the wrong condition. The reasons of a misdiagnosis may be contributed to a series of factors by any of the involved parties, patient or doctor. The lack of time is such a factor. It’s really amazing how little time a doctor will typically spend with a patient. In addition, according to interviewed doctors from several hospitals , it is common that the patients’ medical records are not sorted properly, resulting in further time loss. Time is also wasted when a doctor needs to consult another colleague regarding a patient’s case. The problems previously described led our team to develop the althaea system, a solution that can provide doctors, a radical new approach on a patient’s health record system, with collaboration and portability features.
Technologies used to build Althaea, are (among others): Windows Azure (24/7/365 access to patients data in a fully secured infrastructure), Microsoft Surface 2.0 (giving doctors the ability to see patients' records in full HD with tons of details), Microsoft Lync (for a fully scalable collaboration infrastructure), Silverlight (web version), WPF (desktop & tablet version), Windows Phone 7 (mobile client)

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor of Research in Physiology and Biophysics at Weill Cornell Medicine
Business Process Analyst at the European Investment Bank

projects.title: Spectrum Analyzer
projects.description:
This project's aim was to create a Spectrum Analyzer. 
The first part of the project, was created and implemented using MATLAB, where we tested our FFT-based algorithm.
Next, we had to implement the above-mentioned algorithm on TI's TMS320-C6711 processor using fixed point arithmetic and test its accuracy and efficiency on a variety of simple and complex inputs
 This was a project developed during class "Digital Signal Processing - 2", supervised by Dr. Thanos Stouraitis 
Graded: 9/10 (top 2%)

contributors.headline: Embedded Software Engineer at Feel Therapeutics

projects.title: Noise cancelation and Adaptive filtering
projects.description:
In this project, we implemented and tested various noise cancelation and adaptive filtering techniques, based on known algorithms such as LMS and NLMS. The project was implemented on TI's TMS320-C6711 processor and was tested using audio (containing both usefull info and noise) as input and was tested for its efficiency and accuracy.
This was a project developed during class "Digital Signal Processing - 2", supervised by Dr. Thanos Stouraitis 
Graded: 10/10 (top 1%)

contributors.headline: Embedded Software Engineer at Feel Therapeutics

projects.title: DTMF Analyzer
projects.description:
In this project, we developed a DTMF analyzer based on Goertzel's algorithm. The project was implemented on TI's TMS320-C6711 processor and was tested using various audio (of various frequencies) as input. 
This was a project developed during class "Digital Signal Processing - 2", supervised by Dr. Thanos Stouraitis
Graded: 10/10 (top 1%)

contributors.headline: Embedded Software Engineer at Feel Therapeutics

projects.title: FIR Filtering using TMS320-C6711
projects.description:
In this project, we had to create several IIR Filters, using different algorithms, and we had to filter various inputs (mostly audio) using TI's digital signal processor TMS320-C6711. The project was developed using assembly and we measured performance and accuracy for every filter we created.
This was a project developed during class "Digital Signal Processing - 1", supervised by Dr. Thanos Stouraitis
Graded: 10/10 (top 1%)

contributors.headline: Embedded Software Engineer at Feel Therapeutics

projects.title: PopUP
projects.description: There are various reasons that can lead people to serious injury. Among these reasons, the most dominant one is falls. Our solution, is called PopUP and can be shortly described as a wearable airbag which is enabled when a fall is detected. In order to achieve this, it uses an accelerometer which constantly monitors the g-force values in all three axis and if their values are bigger than the predefined threshold, we can determine that the user is falling. When a fall occurs, the monitoring circuit (Arduino powered) triggers an electronic valve which releases, at once, all the CO2 gas (of a reusable bottle) and fills the airbag. Meanwhile, a mobile application (which is installed on user's cell phone) is constantly connected with the airbag (Arduino) through a bluetooth interface. When a fall occurs, a bluetooth signal is sent from Arduino and the application sends an SMS to a caregiver containing both the last known GPS coordinates of the user and his last known address and it also makes a phone call to one caregiver.

contributors.headline: Associate Professor at Human Centered Computing Group, Computer Science Department, Aalborg University, HCC Group Coordinator & EVU (Further Education) Coordinator for CS Department,

projects.title: beNatural
projects.description: beNatural's goal is to give to consumers the motivation to be more active and informed towards issues concerning environment and sustainability, nutrition and health. In order to achieve this goal we created a website where the user/consumer can get and give information on the ingredients that are part of the products she buys. In order for someone to become a beNatural member all she has to do is to login to our site and voluntarily start providing information to our database about the ingredients of a product she bought. Through the help of many individuals we expect to provide a full scaled database over a period of time. With the help of the site, we can assist each beNatural member when in the process of purchase decisions. For this purpose, we created a mobile application that can be used almost anywhere (e.g. inside a supermarket). The user can ask the beNatural server about the characteristics of a certain product by providing its barcode. The system looks up the beNatural database and by consulting the lists of ingredients that belong to the user's profile, responds by advising on the purchase, according to environmental impact dimensions. Each user can create and edit her own profile which is constituted a) by the ingredients and products that she definitely and personally selects to avoid, b) by the lists with ingredients or products that are issued from respected organisms (i.e. EU Commission, WWF, Greenpeace) and she chooses to comply and c) by the standards, concerning the recycling of packages, she chooses to be informed.

contributors.headline: Account Director | Strong Technical & Business background | Passion for Tech | Goals driven | World citizen
Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing, Human Computer Interaction, Usability expert, Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Formal Software Engineering (FSE) in ASML and its applications:
* Defining the strategy to migrate teams that use the old FSE tool to the next-gen one, using a minimally-intrusive approach.
* Defining the analysis strategy to ensure a safe and successful migration of formally-implemented systems.
* Defining a qualification strategy for future releases of the next-gen FSE tool to assess progression and regression impact.
* Consulting product development teams on the usage and application of FSE in their software.
* Overseeing the development of internal FSE tooling.
* Contributing to ASML's FSE vision and roadmap.
* Steering and working together with engineering teams to lead and assist them during the FSE migrations.
* Coaching ASML's engineers on the usage of the next-gen FSE tooling and other technical aspects.

Member of the Formal Software Engineering Competence:
* Collaborating with ASML's engineering teams on a global scale (NL, US) on product software development using FSE.
* Working together with FSE experts to define research topics for ASML's FSE roadmap.
* Working closely with the academia to identify candidate research projects and ideas.
profile_positions.title: Mid-Senior Software Architect

Formal Software Engineering (FSE) in ASML and its applications:

Conferences:

profile_positions.title: Software Architect

profile_positions.description:
Worked on ASML's next-generation Formal Software Engineering (FSE) approach:
* Participated in the evaluation of different FSE tools, as well as the selection of ASML's next-generation FSE tool.
* Designed and developed tooling that facilitates a sematically-preserving translation from ASML's old FSE tool to the next-gen one.
* Designed and developed a compatibility layer to enable an easier transition from the old FSE tool to the next-gen one.
* Evaluated the above-mentioned tooling on production components of ASML.
* Worked closely together with the supplier of the next-gen FSE tool to ensure ASML's requirements are met.
* Authored an academic project proposal (10-month assignment), which was executed together with the Eindhoven University of Technology. 

Worked on ASML's existing FSE internal tooling:
* Defined a way-of-working for providing support to existing users of ASML's internal FSE tools.
* Proposed redesigns and improvements on the existing internal FSE tools.

Member of the Formal Software Engineering Competence:
* Collaborated with teams within the Netherlands, but also with teams in the US (Wilton, San Diego) on software development using FSE.
* Worked together with ASML's FSE experts on the selection of the next-gen FSE tool.
* Ran two greenfield projects (pilots) with the selected next-gen FSE tool.

Conferences:
* Formal Methods 2019 (FM'19) -- Porto, Portugal
